programme.title: Spencer's Big 30
programme.desc: Vietnamese take-out in just 30 minutes? It's possible! Join chef Spencer Watts in his kitchen as he makes a Vietnamese meal for four that costs around 30 dollars.

programme.title: Spencer's Big 30
programme.desc: Host Spencer Watts takes just 30 minutes to make classic food truck fare, without breaking the bank.

programme.title: Spencer's Big 30
programme.desc: Spencer Watts cooks up a nutritious meal for four featuring Crispy Lemon Chicken, Sweet Potato Rosti, and Baked Peaches.

programme.title: Spencer's Big 30
programme.desc: Host Spencer Watts shows how you can make a delicious family-style roast beef dinner in about 30 minutes, for under 30 dollars.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Sweet and sour are definitely on the menu as Thai-born chef Pailin Chongchitnant whips up glass noodle salad, sour curry, sweet and sour stir fry, and pineapple and lychee in iced syrup.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Argentinian chef Natalia Machado takes us on a culinary tour of Patagonia as she creates popular dishes from the area, including lamb empanadas, King Crab pie, fish in a salt crust, and Patagonian fruit cake.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Vanessa Gianfrancesco, Italian chef extraordinaire, shows us how to prepare bread in delicious ways before cooking the perfect juicy steak, with a side of Tuscan beans, and finishing it all with a light tiramisu.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Noodles are the star ingredients when chef Hana Etsuko Dethlefsen cooks up somen noodles with dipping sauce, ramen salad, a fried noodle dish, and a one-pot delight.

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Korea, Russia, Spain, El Salvador
programme.desc: Join chef Pino Di Cerbo in the Global Veggies kitchen as he creates veggie dishes inspired by South Korea - Jicama Kimchi, Russia - Roasted Eggplant Salad, Spain - Quinoa Paella, and El Salvador - Salvadorian Grilled Iceberg Lettuce Wedge!

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Indonesia, Greece, Syria, Thailand
programme.desc: Join chef Pino Di Cerbo in the Global Veggies kitchen as he creates veggie dishes inspired by Indonesia - Tomato Nasi Goreng, Greece - Greek Melon Salad, Syria - Kidney Bean Hummus, and Thailand - Coconut Curry Cabbage Rolls!

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Sweden, Mexico, Senegal, Italy
programme.desc: Join chef Pino Di Cerbo in the Global Veggies kitchen as he creates veggie dishes inspired by Sweden - Swedish Turnips and Granola, Mexico - Radicchio Tacos, Senegal - Cashew-Sweeth Potato Maafe, and Italy - Bok Choy Fusili!

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 South Africa, Iceland, Bangladesh, Spain
programme.desc: Join chef Pino Di Cerbo in the Global Veggies kitchen as he creates veggie dishes inspired by South Africa - Braaied Rapini, Iceland - Cold Icelandic Pepper Soup, Bangladesh - Edamame Jhalmuri, and Spain - Spanish Broccoli Tortilla!

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Honey, Cherries, Garlic Scapes and Carrots
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera transforms market fresh honey, cherries, garlic scapes and carrots into two simple chic sides and an irresistible dessert.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Sprouts, Veggies and Potatoes
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera creates two summer fresh salads and a hearty breakfast using sprouts, potatoes and leafy lambs quarters.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Kohlrabi, Fennel, Kale and Red Cabbage
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera shows us why fresh is always best with two creative dishes using ingredients from the farmers' market.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Raspberries, Mint, Peas and Apricot
programme.desc: Zestful cook Amanda Herrera scoops up raspberries, peas, mint, and apricots to use in three summer recipes.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.sub-title: S02 : E09 Northern Cuisine: Chiang Mai
programme.desc: Thai chef Pailin Chongchitnant explores the cuisine of Northern Thai city Chiang Mai with red chili pork dip, minced pork salad, Thai-style chicken noodle soup, and Burmese-style curry.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.sub-title: S02 : E12 Corn: Argentina's favourite ingredient
programme.desc: Corn is a big staple ingredient in Argentinian cuisine, and chef Natalia Machado makes tamales, corn and squash and chorizo stew, chicken in a creamy corn sauce, and then creamy corn pudding for dessert.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.sub-title: S02 : E13 Italian dishes that will impress any dinner guest
programme.desc: From a trendy meatball appetizer to creamy pasta with chickpeas, decadent stuffed mussels, and succulent salmon with lavender and honey, Chef Vanessa Gianfrancesco wows again with her Italian cuisine.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef and cookbook author Hana Etsuko Dethlefsen schools us on traditional Japanese foods as she makes tofu rice pockets, miso glazes, and rice flour dumplings.

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 India, Belgium, Italy, China
programme.desc: Join chef Pino Di Cerbo in the Global Veggies kitchen as he creates veggie dishes inspired by India - Bhindi Masala-Style Nopales, Belgium - Belgian Plantain Waffles, Italy - Almond Crusted Portobellos, and China - Sichuan Artichoke Stir Fry!

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 USA, Vietnam, Spain, India
programme.desc: Join chef Pino Di Cerbo in the Global Veggies kitchen as he creates veggie dishes inspired by the USA - Scalloped Cassava Casserole, Vietnam - Pear Summer Rolls, Spain - Hempseed Romesco with Leeks, and India - Potato Biryani Hash!

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Greek home cook Joanna Chery kicks off this episode of One World Kitchen by showcasing popular recipes from Athens. She begins by preparing Chicken Souvlaki with Tzatziki, a classic dish featuring succulent, beautifully charred chicken skewers and a refreshing cucumber yogurt garlic dipping sauce. Next, she fries up some deliciously flaky cod with an irresitble garlic-potato dip, a staple recipe for Greece's Independence Day. Another popular dish in the Greek culture is Lamb Fricassee. It includes crispy, browned lamb pieces, juicy beef stock and a lovely egg - so savoury! Don't forget, we need a perfect dessert to follow a rich and hearty lamb dish: fried dough balls. Joanna shows us her...

programme.title: Spencer's Big 30
programme.desc: Host Spencer Watts cooks up a delicious Greek feast in around 30 minutes, for under 30 dollars.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.sub-title: S03 : E23 Olives: The Most Useful Ingredient
programme.desc: Is there anything more Greek than olives? Host Joanna Chery shows us how versatile the olive really is by cooking up four diverse Greek dishes. To start, a rich, baked-to-perfection Olive Bread loaded with strong, slightly fruity black Kalamata olives. She then prepares a refreshing Greek Village Salad full of seasonal vegetables, creamy feta, and plump juicy olives tossed in extra virgin olive oil. And guess what? It pairs great with fried Olive Bread! Then, Joanna switches it up with wonderful green olives - the star in her delicious stuffing for Apricot and Feta-Stuffed Chicken Thighs. Finally, we're graced with a unique dessert - Saint Fanourios Cake. Joanna adds metaxa (Greek...

programme.title: CombiNation Plates
programme.desc: From Canada to Greece, CombiNATION Plates always covers lots of ground! Kicking off, host Bianca Osbourne wows with ubERS-Canadian Roasted Venison Loin, yummy Fiddlehead Pancakes and sweet-tart Cranberry sauce. Next, enjoy a scenic Mediterranean vacation on a plate with her completely new approach to Greek Salad, taken up a notch or two with tasty seared Albacore Tuna! This episode's 'common ingredient' is lamb shank; check out two wildly creative re- inventions; first, of Canadian TourtieÌ€re, and then, Greek Dolmades. For a final recipe, a dessert fit for a lumberjack or a Greek god! Oka Saganaki with McIntosh Apple Butter and Maple Loukoumades; made with nutty Canadian Oka cheese,...

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Winters in Greece can get chilly, so fun host Joanna Chery warms us up with some hearty Greek dishes. First, she rolls up some tender Meatballs in a Lemon-Egg Sauce featuring a secret ingredient: rice (shh!). Then, she cooks a vegetarian stew that's packed with tasty artichokes, soft-boiled potatoes, and fragrant dill - great for a cool spring night. To finish, she makes a famous Greek dish called Moussaka. Traditionally eaten at Sunday dinner, this dish emulates the warmth of friends and family. Although it's a two part process - it's packed with layered vegetables, a hearty meat sauce and a creamy béchamel on top - it's so worth it!

programme.title: VegHeadz
programme.desc: Chef Pino Di Cerbo leaves no leaf behind in this exciting episode! Things kick off with a fresh salad full of crunchy cabbage and kale, topped with a mango vinaigrette. Then Pino gets wild with dolmades, grape leaves stuffed with wild rice and sweet caramelized onions. Next-up, French fries get friendly with foliage, served with a pile of fried herbs and homemade herb mayo for dipping. In his final creation, Pino reaches for the rainbow...of Swiss chard, that is! The colourful leaves get layered over creamy gorgonzola and puff pastry for a tart that will have you going back for more!

programme.title: DNA Dinners
programme.desc: Jesse Magallanes was raised in an Argentinian household, but he knows there's more to his ancestry. Host Tyrone Edwards reveals the results of his DNA test and Jesse begins his journey of self-discovery.

programme.title: DNA Dinners
programme.desc: Chelsea Richards comes from a Jamaican family but suspects there is more to her ancestry. Host Tyrone Edwards gives her the shock of her life when he reveals the results of her DNA test.

programme.title: DNA Dinners
programme.desc: Host Tyrone Edwards reveals the exciting results of Carmen Araiza's DNA test. She embarks on a journey of self-discovery, learning about her newfound culture through cooking.

programme.title: DNA Dinners
programme.desc: Adopted Tara Broadbent is shocked by the results of her DNA test and learns more about her biological ancestry through food.

programme.title: Let's Brunch
programme.desc: Smiling host Vanessa Gianfrancesco loves Bread for Brunch and so will you! In this episode she shares mouthwatering mid-morning bread recipes.

programme.title: Let's Brunch
programme.desc: Charming host Vanessa is your host for this Dim Sum episode -- try your hand at dumplings, congee and more!

programme.title: Let's Brunch
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Brunch Around The World

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: How do you make any lasagna recipe better? Ask Tiera Singh to take it up, of course! Her 'Nonna-style' bechamel and Bolognese-based Lasagna is topped with melty mozzarella for a luscious and luxuriant dish. Tiera tosses it over to Poppy Sandler, whose sideways Seafood Lasagna mixes up mussels, shrimp, and a briny bechamel sauce - yum! Next, Micah Trainor makes a dressed-up vegetarian version of the classic - her Zucchini-Mushroom Lasagna Rolls with tangy sundried tomatoes, savoury ricotta cheese, and earthy mushroom duxelles is simply superlative. Missy Hui hits the sweet spot with her Chocolate Raspberry Dessert Lasagna; layers of rich white chocolate, thick raspberry coulis, and velvety...

programme.title: Levels of Luxury in Laos
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost

programme.title: The Gainful Grace of Geneva
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost

programme.title: The Thriving Traditions of Taipei

programme.title: The Lion's Share of Lyon

programme.desc: Marko and Alex head to Lyon, France, a city known for its gastronomy and endless history.

programme.title: Oceanside in Okinawa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Ocean breeze, turquoise waters and a whole lot of amazing cuisine. Marko and Alex are soaking up that island life in Okinawa, Japan and learning what makes it so unique.

programme.title: Genoa From Above and Below
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: In Genoa, the brothers cruise the streets, while one of them gets a taste for the lavish lifestyle of Italy's Northwestern port. They take in all the views: heads in the clouds on a high-flying funicular, and just above water at the local aquarium.

programme.title: The L.A. Lifestyle
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Green juice, avocado toast, and surfers galore. Marko and Alex are back home in Los Angeles to explore their town, staycation style. From downtown to the beach, the guys do everything fun under the sun in the city of angels.

programme.title: Snake Island: Philippines

programme.title: Tumalog & Aguinid Falls: Philippines

programme.title: Peaceful Forest Walk: Quebec

programme.title: Humpback Whales

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Food Fact Fun The Hague, Netherlands
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Boarding Pass Rovaniemi, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Great World Hotels, Four Seasons 1(Eng)
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Food Fact Fun Rotterdam, Netherlands
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Boarding Pass Levi, Finland
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Great World Hotels, Four Seasons 2(Eng)
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E14 Food Fact Fun Utrecht, Netherlands
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martin's Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Boarding Pass Ruka Kuusamo, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 World Heritage Ancient Temples of Egypt, Egypt (ENG)
programme.desc: Explore the ancient heritage sites of Abu Simbel, the Philae complex of Nubia and the Hatshepsut Temple to unravel the mystical stories behind the ancient temples of Egypt.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 Food Fact Fun Gouda, Netherlands
programme.desc: Alex tries traditional Dutch food in Leiden, learns about Dutch history at Prinsenhof Museum, visits a Gothic church, a local cheese market and Delftware factory at Gouda.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 10 Days Scotland Isle Of Skye (ENG)
programme.desc: The grand finale of Robbie’s wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E31 Backpack Resavsk Pecina, Serbia
programme.desc: Continue exploring Serbia with Heather as she visits the Manasija monastery, Resavska caves, ending with a joyride onboard Eight of Sargan rail line.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 With Love From Mauritius Ep 1
programme.desc: Krisann and Nathan’s vacation in Mauritius begins in Le Morne, where an unexpected adventure awaits the latter.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Known as Druk Yul or the “Land of the Thunder Dragon”, Bhutan is the country of mountains, monasteries and mystery. Radhika Bangia finds this to be true when she visits Punakha, the former capital of Bhutan, where she marvels at the architecture of Punakha Dzong and gets to know the story behind the two rivers, Mo Chhu and Po Chhu. She also explores the sacred temples and Mebar Tsho lake of Bumthang, the religious heart of Bhutan, and gets to know the local legends.

programme.title: World Spas
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 World Spas Kempenki, Jordan (ENG)
programme.desc: Jamie Srubis tries out spa treatments, which are inspired by the Dead Sea and the desert surroundings at Hotel Kempinski Ishtar in Jordan.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Food Fact Fun Dubai 1
programme.desc: After Burj Khalifa, Alex has a traditional Emirati platter, visits the gold market and skiing rink, and goes for a camel safari and camping.

programme.title: City break
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 City Breaks Innsbruck, Austria
programme.desc: Nestled in the mighty Alps, tour the Austrian city of Innsbruck with Sabrina and explore a town that’s alpine-urban yet traditional in nature.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: In her final leg of journey, Heather visits the Uvac canyon, tries locally prepared pie, ending with Kopaonik National Park and Jelovarnik waterfalls.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 With Love From Mauritius Ep 2
programme.desc: On an island-hopping adventure in Mauritius, Krisann and Nathan find out that time works differently on these islands.

programme.title: XP Guide
programme.sub-title: S01 : E26 XP Guide Copenhagen, Denmark
programme.desc: A homely place where the aroma of freshly baked bread greets you as people smoothly glide along on their bicycles. Welcome to Copenhagen.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Unwind Hotel Oriole, Sri Lanka
programme.desc: Indeya explores the Cinnamon plantations, tries a local dish and witnesses a traditional dance performance.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Food Fact Fun Dubai 2
programme.desc: Alex has varied experiences in Dubai like trying Lebanese cheese bread, visiting a coffee museum, going to IMG Worlds of Adventure and more.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Food Fact Fun Amsterdam, Netherlands
programme.desc: In Amsterdam, Alex tries Bitterballen, cannabis cake and visits Heineken Experience brewery. He explores Zaanse Schans village with windmills and Coster Diamonds, the oldest diamond polishing factory.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes. Navigating the twists of the Royal Mile, strutting around the majestic Edinburgh castle and learning to sip scotch like a true Scotsman, he feels a tad closer to his heritage. The real fun kicks in, however, when he stumbles onto a rather flamboyant way to unleash his inner Highlander.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

programme.title: XP Guide
programme.desc: Stockholm, the capital and largest city of Sweden, was built on 14 Islands. This place is also sometimes referred as Venice of the north.

programme.desc: This exhilarating city of castles, beer and segway rides can take you on a break that will truly leave you catching your breath.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Xplore Bulgaria Sunny Beach
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes. Navigating the twists of the Royal Mile, strutting around the majestic Edinburgh castle and learning to sip scotch like a true Scotsman, he feels a tad closer to his heritage. The real fun kicks in, however, when he stumbles onto a rather flamboyant way to unleash his inner Highlander.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s adventures in Perth kick off with him immersing himself in the historic grandeur of the Scone Castle, where a mysterious stone tells tales of Scottish monarchs. But the real thunder of the Highlands awaits at the Braemar Games gathering, where tartan meets brawn, and Robbie learns that embracing his Scottish side involves more than just kilts and castles.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E27 Backpack Novi Sad, Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Novi Sad, the financial and industrial hub of Serbia.Starting with canoeing on Danube and later exploring the city and its landmarks.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Boarding Pass Santa Village, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Xplore Bulgaria Sunny Beach
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how?

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Food Fact Fun The Hague, Netherlands
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Boarding Pass Rovaniemi, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Great World Hotels, Four Seasons 1(Eng)
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Food Fact Fun Rotterdam, Netherlands
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Boarding Pass Levi, Finland
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Great World Hotels, Four Seasons 2(Eng)
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E14 Food Fact Fun Utrecht, Netherlands
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martin's Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Boarding Pass Ruka Kuusamo, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 World Heritage Ancient Temples of Egypt, Egypt (ENG)
programme.desc: Explore the ancient heritage sites of Abu Simbel, the Philae complex of Nubia and the Hatshepsut Temple to unravel the mystical stories behind the ancient temples of Egypt.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 Food Fact Fun Gouda, Netherlands
programme.desc: Alex tries traditional Dutch food in Leiden, learns about Dutch history at Prinsenhof Museum, visits a Gothic church, a local cheese market and Delftware factory at Gouda.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 10 Days Scotland Isle Of Skye (ENG)
programme.desc: The grand finale of Robbie’s wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E31 Backpack Resavsk Pecina, Serbia
programme.desc: Continue exploring Serbia with Heather as she visits the Manasija monastery, Resavska caves, ending with a joyride onboard Eight of Sargan rail line.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 With Love From Mauritius Ep 1
programme.desc: Krisann and Nathan’s vacation in Mauritius begins in Le Morne, where an unexpected adventure awaits the latter.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Known as Druk Yul or the “Land of the Thunder Dragon”, Bhutan is the country of mountains, monasteries and mystery. Radhika Bangia finds this to be true when she visits Punakha, the former capital of Bhutan, where she marvels at the architecture of Punakha Dzong and gets to know the story behind the two rivers, Mo Chhu and Po Chhu. She also explores the sacred temples and Mebar Tsho lake of Bumthang, the religious heart of Bhutan, and gets to know the local legends.

programme.desc: High tech turbo cars from the 80's get together at the SalzburgRing.

programme.title: DreamCars
programme.desc: BMW X5M, Audi Q7, Mercedes GLS, and Porsche Cayenne turbo are the strongest and fastest SUVs of the world. Sports utility vehicles Made in Germany are the embodiment of technical perfection, superior performance and unique comfort.

programme.title: DreamCars
programme.desc: Packed with power, panache and charm, a diverse range of high-end SUVs from across the world shows how luxury comes in all sizes and shapes.

programme.title: DreamCars
programme.desc: They represent the American lifestyle more than any other car: US SUVs and pickup trucks. They are extremely large, extremely powerful and extremely luxurious and they transport the feeling of unlimited possibilities and adventure.

programme.title: Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10
programme.desc: The Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10 has its origins in the Japanese army; its shape won't win any beauty contests or achieve the best results in the wind tunnel, but this is not really the point with an SUV like this.

programme.title: Ignition GT
programme.desc: The Suzuki Jimny and Land Rover Defender face off in a 4x4 showdown; Gugu finds out if the Audi RSQ8 is a worthy flagship; a preview of future content plans.

programme.title: Buyer's Guide
programme.desc: Recommendations for a car with a budget of R220 000; performance cars from Porsche, VW and Audi come under the spotlight; examining Mazda 3's fuel consumption.

programme.title: Sold in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: We're back at Montecasino for the 2024 Creative Rides Auction; classics like the Holden Monaro GTS and Mercedes-Benz 220 S convertible go under the hammer and a bespoke Ford Hot Rod adds some local flavour into the mix.

programme.title: Petrol Heads
programme.desc: At the 2025 Idle Auto Expo in Johannesburg, custom builds and innovations take centre stage; from a Rocket Bunny Mazda RX7 and a custom VW Caddy to a replica Fast and Furious S2000; a 190E AMG swap and a 1300hp BMW M240.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Being one step ahead of time has always been a bit pricier. But is the new BMW i8 just an luxurious, avant-garde carrier of technology or can it already be considered as a serious sports car? Why should you pay double the price compared to the BMW.

programme.title: Super Cars
programme.desc: Exploring the luxury, speed, and high-tech power of the fastest and finest cars in the world; the workmanship, the highest level of engineering, and the most expensive price are the deciding factors for the winner of the Supercar Title.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: These days there's hardly a car manufacturer who doesn't build any kind of SUV. Three of the sportiest SUVs on the market are the Porsche Macan Turbo, Mercedes GLA 45 AMG and Audi RSQ3. Each of them comes with more than 300 HP.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: The Porsche Panamera Turbo S is the most dynamic sedan in the world. No other car finds the perfect balance between calm gliding on the one hand and extreme performance on the other hand.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Supercars drives the new LS 600h, the BMW Actiev Hybrid 7, and the Porsche Panamera S E-Hybrid. Luxury does not necessarily mean to waste time.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: The Slivretta Hochalpenstrasse in Austria is the ideal playground for the Lotus Elise and the Roding Roadster.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Most people associate Aston Martin with James Bond, luxury, style, and elegance. The Vantage N430 is a sports car that makes you feel the heritage of British race cars. It is elegant, fast, comes with a marvelous sound.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Mercedes presents its first plug-in hybrid car with the S500. With an electric range of 33 kilometers, a declared average consumption of 2.8 liters, and a system output of 442 horses the S500 is the most efficient luxury car on the market.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: BMW, one of the most successful automobile groups in the world, promises the joy of driving.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Porsche 550 Spyder is small, flat and fast. It wrote history, even though only 140 of them were produced.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The motor sport history of Ford.

programme.title: Car History

programme.title: Car History

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The crew at BSG Racing is familiar with spectacular conversions. Dirk Hattenhauer and his boys have already refined a lot of cars and now they perform a special project, as they want to refurbish an old Opel Kadett C Coupe.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: A lot of work, attention to detail and passion is packed into a tuned show car. But it might take some time until a car like this is ready to stand on its own four wheels.

programme.title: Never Just Win: The Making of a World Rally Champion
programme.desc: Never Just Win is a full-length documentary that looks back on the incredible 2024 World Rally Championship, which saw Thierry Neuville and Martijn Wydaeghe lift the Drivers' and Co-Drivers' titles in their Hyundai i20 N Rally1 Hybrid WRC car after an epic battle with their teammates Ott Tanak and Martin Jarveoja that went right to the final day of the season The film gives you exclusive behind-the-scenes access to the Hyundai Shell Mobis World Rally Team, featuring Esapekka Lappi and Janne Ferm, Andreas Mikkelsen and Torstein Eriksen, Dani Sordo and Cándido Carrera, Christian Loriaux, and Cyril Abiteboul, throughout one of the most dramatic and tense World Rally Championship seasons...

programme.title: 2025 Hail International Rally - Full Review
programme.desc: All the highlights from the 2025 Hail International Rally in Saudi Arabia.

programme.title: Leclerc Looks Back at Highlights from his F1 Career
programme.desc: Charles Leclerc has had some huge moments in his career, from spectacular wins to helping the team develop even before he raced for Ferrari's F1 team. We sat down with Leclerc and brought him 5 photos from his career, asking him to pinpoint where he was and why each photo is so special to him.

programme.title: Life in Pictures: Mark Webber
programme.desc: Nine-time grand prix winner Mark Webber spent 12 years in Formula 1, most of them in the teeth of adversity: from wrestling with sub-optimal machinery at Minardi and Jaguar to providing adult supervision at a young Red Bull Racing, and a not always happy partnership with Sebastian Vettel. We take you through Webber’s early career and path to F1, from his arrival in the UK and Formula Ford in 1996, to joining up with Benetton and Flavio Briatore in 2001 and his transition to Jaguar and eventually Red Bull Racing. All photos used are taken from Motorsport Images, the largest collection of motorsport pictures in the world. (Warning, video contains some explicit language)

programme.desc: Watch all of the action from round 7 of the Belgian Rally Championship, the A&D Rally Omloop van Vlaanderen.

programme.desc: Watch the first race of the third round of the 2025 Castrol Toyota Formula Regional Championship season at Manfeild Circuit Chris Amon, New Zealand.

programme.desc: All the highlights from the 2025 Hail International Rally in Saudi Arabia.

programme.title: Leclerc Looks Back at Highlights from his F1 Career
programme.desc: Charles Leclerc has had some huge moments in his career, from spectacular wins to helping the team develop even before he raced for Ferrari's F1 team. We sat down with Leclerc and brought him 5 photos from his career, asking him to pinpoint where he was and why each photo is so special to him.

programme.title: Round 3: Manfeild Circuit Chris Amon - Race 1
programme.desc: Watch the first race of the third round of the 2025 Castrol Toyota Formula Regional Championship season at Manfeild Circuit Chris Amon, New Zealand.

programme.title: Never Just Win: The Making of a World Rally Champion
programme.desc: Never Just Win is a full-length documentary that looks back on the incredible 2024 World Rally Championship, which saw Thierry Neuville and Martijn Wydaeghe lift the Drivers' and Co-Drivers' titles in their Hyundai i20 N Rally1 Hybrid WRC car after an epic battle with their teammates Ott Tanak and Martin Jarveoja that went right to the final day of the season The film gives you exclusive behind-the-scenes access to the Hyundai Shell Mobis World Rally Team, featuring Esapekka Lappi and Janne Ferm, Andreas Mikkelsen and Torstein Eriksen, Dani Sordo and Cándido Carrera, Christian Loriaux, and Cyril Abiteboul, throughout one of the most dramatic and tense World Rally Championship seasons...

programme.title: S'abandonner au Sauvage

programme.title: Keep On Keeping On

programme.title: Beni SpeedTransalp
programme.desc: For this route from Ruhpolding (GER) to Kasern (ITA), 210 kilometers and more than 10000 meters of vert, recreational athletes need approximately five to seven days. Benedikt Boehm is aiming for the magic time limit of 36 hours, non-stop.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Freeride World Tour 2020 "Live Summary"
programme.desc: The season kick-off of the world’s most important freeride series for skiers and snowboarders will be held at Hakuba (JPN).

programme.title: Cape Epic 2023 - Stage 7
programme.desc: The Absa Cape Epic is the world's premier mountain bike stage race. The route changes every year and takes ambitious amateur and professional mountain bikers from all over the world over 650 untamed kilometres through pristine landscapes.

programme.title: Cape Epic 2024 - Prologue
programme.desc: The Absa Cape Epic is the world’s premier mountain bike stage race. The route changes every year, leading aspiring amateur and professional mountain bikers from around the world through 617 Untamed kilometres of unspoilt scenery and up 16 500m of climbing.

programme.title: Cape Epic 2024 - Stage 1
programme.desc: The Absa Cape Epic is the world’s premier mountain bike stage race. The route changes every year, leading aspiring amateur and professional mountain bikers from around the world through 617 Untamed kilometres of unspoilt scenery and up 16 500m of climbing.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2021 - #2 Ordino Arcalís (AND)
programme.desc: The world's best freeriders compete again at this years Freeride World Tour. The second stop takes place in Ordino Arcalís, Andorra on the February 24th. The Andorran Pyrenees offers an amazing variety of terrain and venues that could host the competition.

programme.title: Mystic Sk8 Cup 2017 - Prague (CZE)
programme.desc: During the first weekend in July, Prague will be dominated by Mystic Sk8 Cup skateboarding festival, celebrating its 23th annual. This year’s MSC will be the largest skateboarding event on the European continent.

programme.title: South African Surf Session - Dungeons (RSA)
programme.desc: Big wave surfing is a discipline in which experienced surfers paddle into orare towed onto waves which are at least 20 feet (6.2 m) high. There are only a few placeson the globe with famous big waves and Dungeons in South Africa is one of them.

programme.title: Dolomites SkyRace 2017 - Canazei/TRentino (ITA)
programme.desc: This summer, the Italian mountain region of Trentino is once again the place to be for the international skyrunnning elite. Thanks to its diverse landscape with scenic mountains, Trentino is the ideal host for a skyrunnning race.

programme.title: Inside Surfing Ep.1
programme.desc: Inside Surfing tells the stories about the people, places and things that make surfing so special. Is it a sport, an art form or a lifestyle, or all three at the same time? The series provides a look behind the scenes of surfing with all its facets.

programme.desc: Trans Madeira combines the best things the island has to offer with five days of racing in the World’s most diverse terrain, exploring all four corners of the island, starting high in the mountains and finishing down at the ocean.

programme.title: E-Bike World Tour 2024

programme.desc: Two successful competitions went down in Ordino Arcalís, and now it’s Crunch Time for athletes striving to keep their campaigns on track in Fieberbrunn, Austria.

programme.title: Come Prepared - Dangerous Dungeons - Cape Town (RSA)
programme.desc: There are just a handful waves all over the planet that are the perfect setting for Big Wave Surfing. And Dungeons is one of them. It´s a thunderous, right-breaking wave, located at Hout Bay, Cape Town, South Africa.

programme.title: Tortour 2017 (SUI) & Mountain Festival (ESP)
programme.desc: The incredible landscapes of the Parc National D'Aigüestortes i Estany de Sant Maurici as well as the magical settings of La Vall de Boí have been the chosen venue for the celebration, of the first edition of BUFF® MOUNTAIN VALL DE BOI FESTIVAL.

programme.title: Transmaurienne Vanoise - MTB Stage Race (FRA)
programme.desc: The world's biggest cycling area hosts one of the most beautiful mountain bike races in the world, and of course it's right here in the French Alps, in the Haute Maurienne/Vanoise region. It is the incredible Transmaurienne 2017!

programme.title: Inside Surfing Ep.6
programme.desc: Inside Surfing tells the stories about the people, places and things that make surfing so special. Is it a sport, an art form or a lifestyle, or all three at the same time? The series provides a look behind the scenes of surfing with all its facets.

programme.title: LINE OF SIGHT | A Look into Wingsuit BASE Jumping
programme.desc: The golden age of wingsuiting is upon us. Through evolving suit technology the initial inflation time has gone down, which has lead to quicker starts and more exits. Wingsuit athletes Marshal Miller, Jesse Hall, and Sean Chuma take you through the iconic jumps.

programme.title: THE RIO CAQUETA
programme.desc: Jules Domine and Tyler Bradt, obsessed and addicted to whitewater adventure, make a plan to journey the long way, from the source of Rio Caqueta 1,000 Kilometers downstream to an unreal big water canyon deep in the Colombian Amazon.

programme.title: A Plea For Refuge
programme.desc: Two adventurous friends, Jeff Shapiro and Cody Tuttle, have a desire to experience one of the last, raw, and truly preserved wilderness areas on the North American continent, attempt to hike and fly paraglider's across the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge in Alaska.

programme.title: Swatch Timeline - This Is My Winter
programme.desc: Experience the mountain with the myth-Xavier De Le Rue. There are so many moments so many adventures so many ways of seeing the mountains. You only need a few magic days to film a part for a snowboard film. But this season it took me six months - so: This is my winter.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #11: Epic Series – Season Preview
programme.desc: Today we take you on an exciting journey. Get ready for an exclusive preview of the Absa Cape Epic and the Epic Series 2025 - the ultimate test of endurance, skill and teamwork.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #12: Mediterranean Epic by Scott 2025
programme.desc: February 6-9, 2025, Oropesa del Mar (ESP): The Mediterranean Epic is a UCI 4-stage race where mountain bikers can enjoy mountain biking to the fullest on the course around Oropesa del Mar in the province of Castellón in Spain.

programme.title: Desert Dash Namibia 2024
programme.desc: The Desert Dash 2024 is an exhilarating mountain biking event that challenges riders to conquer the breathtaking terrain of the Namib Desert. Spanning over 24 hours, participants embark on a grueling 369-kilometer journey.

programme.title: Cape Epic 2025 - Prologue
programme.desc: The Cape Epic 2025 is one of the world's most important mountain bike stage races in the rugged landscape of South Africa. The event promises intense competition and unforgettable adventures

programme.title: Climbing Special - Worldwide
programme.desc: Kashmir, the Moab Desert, the famous Matterhorn, icefalls in Norway and Patagonia. We look back on breathtaking adventures, incredible alpine records and never-before-imagined new ascents

programme.title: adidas Rockstars 2019 - Stuttgart (GER)
programme.desc: The popular competition for the international climbing elite is taking place for the ninth time. Around 4,000 spectators can cheer as world and European champions, World Cup winners and Olympic champions show why bouldering is one of the most difficult disciplines of all.

programme.title: Expedition Antarctica - Caro North - Antarctic
programme.desc: Ice climbing, ski mountaineering and days of sailing on open waters through the infamous Drake Passage: 28-year-old extreme athlete Caro North set off for a four-week expedition to the far south of our continent.

programme.title: Red Bull Romaniacs 2022 (ROU)
programme.desc: The Red Bull Romaniacs Extreme Enduro Rally was created in 2004 and takes place for the 19th time this year. The race is spread over five days, the first being the inner-city prologue in front of thousands of enthusiastic fans.

programme.title: FIA Karting World Championships (KZ/KZ2)
programme.desc: The first of the two world championship events of the 2022 FIA Karting season offers a very attractive programme with five categories and more than 320 drivers taking part in Le Mans (FRA) from 1st to 4th September.

programme.title: FIA Karting World Championships (OK/OKJ)

programme.title: Red Bull Romaniacs 2024 - Sibiu (ROU) - 150min Leatt LiveManiacs Summary
programme.desc: In this year’s 21st edition of the event, competitors from about 60 nations will be competing, among them the world’s best hard enduro riders like Manuel Lettenbichler (GER), Graham Jarvis (UK), Wade Young (RSA), Mario Roman (ESP) and Teodor Kabakchiev (BUL).

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024 - Ibiraquera (BRA)

programme.title: GWA Wingfoil World Cup 2024 – Dakhla (MAR) – Overall Highlights
programme.desc: The GWA Wingfoil World Cup 2024 is coming to Dakhla, bringing the best wingfoilers in the world to this Moroccan paradise. With its reliable winds and breathtaking landscapes, Dakhla offers the perfect backdrop for exciting races.

programme.title: Copa Kitley GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup 2024 – Cauipe (BRA) – Overall Highlights
programme.desc: The Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour 2024 will host the second stop of the freestyle discipline in Cauipe in north-eastern Brazil. The Copa Kitley GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup offers intense competitions in the shallow waters.
